image.altText: A black and brown puppy held by a boy

props.synopsis: Downpours during the Australian Kelpie Muster bring smiles, not scowls, to a drought-stricken town in western Victoria.

title.children: Tails wag at kelpie muster as rain drenches town ravaged by drought

image.altText: A close up shot of a man's hand holding a rain gauge showing almost 24mm of rain

props.synopsis: Much-needed rain has soaked parched land across parts of South Australia but farmers say more is required to break the drought.

title.children: Rain a 'celebration' but not a drought-breaker for SA farmers

image.altText: Three children on a large dinosaur statue.

props.synopsis: An unexpected online auction buy lands an 8-metre-long, 3m-high dinosaur in a Milang front yard, bringing smiles and new visitors to the struggling town.

title.children: How an impulse purchase gone wrong became town's unofficial mascot

image.altText: Artist Jungle looks into the camera smiling, he wears glasses and a dress hat and jacket both covered in splotches of paint.

props.synopsis: Jungle could once paint around 100 works in one sitting. Today he might be a little slower, but his joyful expression on canvas hasn't diminished a bit.

title.children: Why walking through this artist's home is an unforgettable experience

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown resting on lane ropes in the pool after a swimming race at the Olympic Games, looking at the timing board

props.synopsis: Defending 50m backstroke world champion Kaylee McKeown appeared to have her hopes of defending the crown dashed, after being disqualified from her heat on the opening day of the Australian Swimming Trials.

title.children: Aussie Kaylee McKeown disqualified, but wins protest at world champ trials

image.altText: Baby twins, Max (left) and Blake (right) sit on their parents's laps wearing matching Bluey jumpers

props.synopsis: Researchers in Adelaide are looking to expand newborn heel-prick screening to help identify up to 600 additional genetic conditions early.

title.children: Up to 1,000 families to take part in newborn heel-prick screening research

image.altText: Baz Luhrmann wearing a dark green and silver suit and Catherine Martin in a dark green long sleeve dress with silver flowers

props.synopsis: Some 830 Australians will be recognised as part of the King's Birthday 2025 honours on Monday, including film director Baz Luhrmann and his frequent collaborator Catherine Martin, an award-winning costume, production and set designer.

title.children: King's Birthday honours list includes Hollywood heavyweights, local heroes

image.altText: A frowning woman with curly blonde hair and wearing a blue shirt sits in front of an open laptop.

props.synopsis: A clinical psychologist warns that winter rain will not "wash away the worries" caused by severe drought across southern Australia.

title.children: More farmers seek mental health support as drought a 'daily rollercoaster'

image.altText: A woman flinches as she is pulled to safety away from a crowd

props.synopsis: Governor Gavin Newsom says the US president "flamed the fires" and accuses him of an "unmistakable step toward authoritarianism".

title.children: California sues Trump administration as president calls for governor's arrest

image.altText: members of the national guard in riot gear stand in a line

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's deployment of the National Guard was a historic moment — 60 years ago, another president did the same thing for a very different reason.

title.children: 'The eyes of the world' watched the last time the National Guard descended

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Penny Wong

props.synopsis: Generation X is overwhelmingly in charge of government and increasingly holding the wealth.

title.children: Australia's political class is full of gen Xers who could address inequality

image.altText: lady sitting on orange couch smiling at camera

props.synopsis: When Geranium Primary School was forced to close its doors due to dwindling enrolment numbers, it shut a century-old chapter for the tiny town. But then one former teacher with big dreams stepped in to help her town blossom again.

title.children: Town of 80 buys old primary school for $1.10 and turns it into op shop

image.altText: A man with a blonde mohawk, glasses and gold jacket stands in front of microphone

props.synopsis: His publicist says Stone died surrounded by family after contending with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and other ailments.

title.children: Breaking: Sly Stone, frontman of Sly and The Family Stone, dies aged 82

image.altText: Elon Musk raises his hands to his sunglasses as Donald Trump, wearing a MAGA cap, stands behind him.

props.synopsis: As the space race once again heats up to a level not seen since the Cold War, the United States has found itself in an unenviable position of reliance on SpaceX.

title.children: SpaceX has leverage on NASA. That ups the stakes for Trump's fight with Musk

image.altText: Crowds inside the airport.

props.synopsis: A Qantas flight (QF2) flying from London to Singapore has been forced to make an urgent landing in Azerbaijan, after a passenger suffered a life-threatening cardiac emergency mid-flight.

title.children: Hundreds stranded in Azerbaijan as Qantas plane makes urgent landing

image.altText: A 3D graphic of a large long-necked sauropod with yellowish skin standing on mud next to pine-like trees.

props.synopsis: The first reported fossilised stomach contents from a sauropod, belonging to a Diamantinasaurus that lived 95 million years ago, has confirmed a long-held theory of herbivorous behaviour.

title.children: Gut fossil from Aussie dinosaur 'Judy' first to show what sauropods ate

image.altText: Stickers advertising Afterpay and Zip on the window of a clothing store.

props.synopsis: Consumer protections that apply to credit products such as hardship requests will now apply to BNPL providers such as Afterpay and Zip.

title.children: As the US reacts to burrito-now, pay later, Australia regulates BNPL

image.altText: A family stands next to a dam with some water in it on a farm.

props.synopsis: Victorian farmers breathed a sigh of relief across the weekend as much-needed rain fell across the state.

title.children: 'Grinning our heads off': Farmers ecstatic after much-needed rains

image.altText: A man stands in rubble

props.synopsis: It's the latest in a series of retaliations from Moscow since Ukraine destroyed a number of Russian bombers in drone attacks on air bases deep in the country earlier this month.

title.children: Ukraine says Russia launched biggest drone attack of the war

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff and Tasmanian liberals in parliament.

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff is expected to go to the state's governor later today to seek a snap election after parliament passes an emergency budget supply bill.

title.children: Tasmania likely to end the day with a state election underway

image.altText: A large white coral-like boulder tube and a scuba diver in deep blue water.

props.synopsis: Damage to sensitive sea floor ecosystems sparks calls for tighter regulation of the tourist ship industry in the Antarctic region.

title.children: World-first footage shows Antarctic sea floor scoured by cruise ship anchors

image.altText: A man in a pink suit stands before a sign reading 'IT ENDS WITH US'

props.synopsis: Baldoni had accused Lively, her husband Ryan Reynolds, their publicist, the New York Times and others of orchestrating a smear campaign to extort him.

title.children: Judge dismisses Baldoni's defamation lawsuit against Lively

image.altText: Chief Photographer

props.synopsis: A new study finds that EV myths are so ingrained in society that even owners believe misinformation that they catch fire more easily and emit electromagnetic fields that damage health.

title.children: Are EVs more likely to catch fire? Why we're still falling for the myths

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The new proclamation, which Trump signed last week, applies to citizens from 12 mainly African and Middle Eastern countries.

title.children: Trump's new travel ban on citizens from 12 nations takes effect

image.altText: Mark Carney sits at a conference table with a red backdrop and a Canadian flag placed in front of him.

props.synopsis: The new funds towards missiles and submarines came as NATO publicly urged European nations to increase their defence budgets.

title.children: 'Act with urgency': Canada unveils major defence spending boost

image.altText: Viktor Orban kissing the hand of Marine Le Pen on a stage in front of crowds.

props.synopsis: Speeches from prominent politicians featured attacks on the European Union and migration policies, as they seek to rally French voters ahead of presidential elections.

title.children: As their popularity surges, European far-right parties stage rally in France

image.altText: Mat Ryan of the Socceroos looks on after making a save

props.synopsis: Socceroos goalkeeper Mat Ryan is relishing his time in the Australian goal as he approaches 100 caps for his country.

title.children: Milestone man Ryan thought Socceroos career was over

image.altText: A man examines an engraved stone

props.synopsis: A contractor was digging beneath the rubble of a destroyed house in the town of Maarat al-Numan in May when he made the startling find.

title.children: Contractor discovers underground Byzantine tomb complex in Syria

image.altText: Two men wrestle on inside a UFC octagon. Seen through the wire of its fence, one man straddles the other.

props.synopsis: Beneath the profitable success story of the UFC lies a hidden reality: many athletes who have dedicated their careers to the sport are struggling and are unable to fight back.

title.children: Tyson was 'willing to die' for the UFC. He changed his mind after getting paid

image.altText: Two women sit by a tennis court with their two dogs

props.synopsis: Many religious scholars consider petting dogs or coming into contact with their saliva as ritually impure, while others see them as a symbol of Western influence.

title.children: Iran expands dog-walking ban, citing 'public health, peace and comfort' concerns

image.altText: A drone shot of a plot of land

props.synopsis: New peer-reviewed research has found artificial intelligence could help boost productivity in urban planning but some experts warn government regulation is needed in the adoption of AI.

title.children: Artificial intelligence could help plan cities, but there are downsides

image.altText: A man standing in desert bush land rests his arms on a shovel.

props.synopsis: Indigenous employment rules have been dropped from two-thirds of Commonwealth contracts, meaning $70 billion worth of contracts did not have to hire a minimum number of Indigenous people or use Indigenous businesses.

title.children: Indigenous employment rules dropped from most Commonwealth contracts

image.altText: Sarah Snook standing on stage with an award and a microphone in front of her, wearing a tight fitting glittery dress

props.synopsis: Australian actor Sarah Snook has won the Tony award for Best Leading Actress in a Play for The Picture of Dorian Gray, with fellow Australian Marg Horwell also taking home a Tony for Costume Design.

title.children: Sarah Snook wins Tony award for lead performance in The Picture of Dorian Gray
